page.title: 11BEARSTED LIBRARY
page.content: Bearsted library is situated in the centre of the village in an old picturesque building, which was once the village school and one of the focal points of the village. It was given the role of library in Sept. 1975. It caters mainly for the village centre as there is another library on the other side of the village. The library noticeboard provides details of local events and activities that are taking place in the village. Both Bearsted and Thurnham Parish Council minutes can be found on display to anyone wishing to inspect them. The library is open every day except Monday and Sunday. It has a late night for many of the readers are regular commuters not arriving home until after 6pm. It provides a valuable service to an expanding area of Bearsted and Thurnham.
